job_description:
Who we are
Fagron is the world’s leading pharmaceutical compounding company and offers prescribers the broadest possible range of therapeutic options. We are committed to improving the lives of millions of people across the world by developing unique concepts and innovative solutions to meet the growing global demand for customized medication. We focus on personalized medicine so we can help everyone with medicine based on their needs.
About the job
This is an excellent opportunity to take the next step in your career and make a difference as FP&A Junior Analyst. You will participate in several financial and data-driven projects, building reports and analyzing business performance to support strategic decisions.

You will be part of the Global Finance team in Rotterdam, reporting to the Global FP&A Manager and working jointly with the accounting and consolidation specialists, to translate numbers into insights. A collaborative and proactive attitude, analytical reasoning and a result-driven approach must be in your core. You are curious, data savvy, good with numbers, like getting things done and constantly looking for improvements.

What will you do?
Generate recurring reports and dashboards for the leadership team ensuring they are delivered timely and with accuracy.
Prepare external reporting on business performance, and support the preparation of quarterly press releases, board of directors’ presentations and other external analytics.
You will build effective relationships with regional and local finance teams.
Assists with forecasting, and annual operating budget processes including supporting the local teams and compiling figures into presentation format.
Responsible for preparing the company’s reporting packages, summarizing company's performance for various periods.
Translate business results into impactful visuals.

Set yourself apart

Bachelor degree in Finance or Business-related subjects. Master’s degree is a plus.
Analytical skills, accuracy, attention to detail and ability to set priorities to timely achieve high-quality results.
Initiative and capability to communicate across the organization, working individually as well as in a team.
1 to 2 years work experience in a similar position.
Excellent knowledge of reporting, Excel/PowerPoint, and Power BI.
Fluent spoken and written English.
Knowledge of consolidation systems is a plus.

What's on offer?
We offer a unique working environment where talent and ambition can develop to its fullest. We have an open and informal organization culture, where you need to be able to work independently. Fagron is a young, professional and ambitious company with plenty of growth opportunities and we will offer you a competitive compensation.
Job Reference: FA02524
pros:
['- Great supervisor
- Allowed autonomy and responsibility
- Flexible working schedules (WFH, starting a bit later in the morning, etc.)', 'Flexibility, schedule, workload, employees, hours', 'Flexible hours. Little to no oversight.', 'Flexible schedule management is understanding of life events etc.', 'Fagron is a dynamic and fast paced company. For all employees, change and growth is the norm. Growth opportunities exist, but may require patience, or making yourself stand out.', "Flexible schedule
Benefits okay
It's a good resume builder"]
cons:
["can't think of any cons", 'Management, pay, favoritism, clique, communication', 'Management at all levels is totally clueless about managing and is completely disengaged, even negligent, concerning the well-being and happiness of their staff. This company is foolish in that it does not recognize or reward high-performing staff but instead allows, and even promotes, people who are terrible communicators, lazy, incompetent, and know how to speak what upper management wants to hear instead of what they need to hear. People who achieved management positions are sycophants. Because of lack of oversight of people's work ethic or productivity several staff abuse this situation and "work from home" when the weather is bad for driving or they don't feel well. This creates a two-tier system or class of employees: those who get to choose when they want to work on-site or in person and those who do not have that option or ability because of the nature of their job. In one phrase: There is no accountability and no recognition. This is a toxic comapny to work for and they are incompetent beyond words to adequately describe. Run away as fast as you can.', 'Training is poor, promotable from within for jobs that don’t pay well. Restructuring all the time only benefiting management. Honestly most people are just winging it and the disfunction shows.', 'Change can be difficult, and cause uncertainty in your work environment; Fagron is not a good fit if this is uncomfortable. Pay is generally at or slightly below average rates for similar positions.', 'Poor leadership
Low compensation
Unstable work environment
Lack of investment in employees
Technology and software is old']

job_description:
Make your mark for patients
We are looking for a RWE Expert with a passion for data and enthusiastic innovative mindset, to come join our fantastic Global Real World Evidence Team, based in either Belgium, Germany or UK. We are also open to other EU locations, Netherlands or Switzerland.
About the role
As the RWE Expert, you will be responsible for designing and executing global real-world evidence (RWE) projects to inform strategic internal decision-making thereby empowering differentiating R&D activities within UCB, support external decision making by key stakeholder groups such as patients, regulators, policy makers, payers, and prescribers and contribute to the wider epidemiological and medical understanding of specific diseases.
Depending on business need, you will help conceptualize RWE projects to meet business needs and drive the Global RWE Strategy and Tactical Plan.
Who you’ll work with:
You work with the RWE Data Analyst team, the RWE Strategy Lead and internal stakeholders. And you represent RWE on functional teams within the Mission(s) (e.g., early/development solution teams, Medical Team, Patient Safety, Regulatory, Market Access, Commercial/Marketing, Core Launch Teams. You report directly to the RWE Strategy Lead.
What will you do:
Providing strategic input to internal stakeholders based on RWE activities and robust epidemiological and medical understanding of the patient population in focus
Leading and driving innovative RWE study design, planning and execution, including protocol development and analysis specification following best methodological standards. Including new data sources and advanced analytics. (incl. digital pharmacoepidemiology)
Providing input to helps drive the Global RWE Strategy & Tactical Plan based on request from the RWE Strategy Lead responsible for the respective patient population
Providing RWE Analysts with clarifications concerning protocol implementation
Driving interpretation of analysis in collaboration with RWE Strategy Lead & internal stakeholders, and communicating analysis interpretation internally and externally
Supporting RWE Strategy Lead to ensure alignment of RWE tactics with the Strategic Publication Plan.
Interested? For this position you’ll need the following education, experience and skills:
MSc. / PhD in Life Sciences of which Epidemiology background is preferred, other like Outcome research, statistical backgrounds are favorable
You have successfully conceptualized and delivered RWE projects using primary or secondary data (within the pharmaceutical industry or with a recognized expert consultancy or academic center of excellence)
Ability to translate project work into scientific communications, and deliver impactful presentations to peers and/or internal stakeholders with a relaxed and proficient presentation style
Experience working with multidisciplinary cross functional and cross-cultural project teams
Ability to use your relationships with internal and external stakeholder groups to provide strategic input through synthesized thinking, building advocacy and empowering implementation of the solutions in support of creating patient value and UCB portfolio performance
Passion for innovation and creativity. Able to learn fast and adapt to new ways of working, be open-minded and science driven
RANDATUCB
Are you ready to ‘go beyond’ to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!
About us
UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.
Why work for us?
At UCB, we don’t just complete tasks, we create value. We aren’t afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected and has equitable opportunities to do their best work. We ‘go beyond’ to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that’s on our patients, our employees or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.
Learn more about sustainability at UCB and how it is integrated into our business approach.
UCB and its subsidiaries encourage diversity and inclusion in the workplace; we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race/colour/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity.
pros: ['Amazing place to work so far', 'great pipeline, always striving for the patients', 'Good work flexibility. Patient value drive mindset', 'Management open to new ideas and suggestions for improving efficiency. Executive management really listens to employee feedback and takes action to remedy any issues promptly. Great benefits, base salary seems on the low end but generous bonus, 401k match and stock options.', 'Good pay, solid benefits - autonomy to do your job', 'Global company with many opportunitiues internationally', 'Company has good opportunities for growth.', 'Training Salary/Compensation Benefits Work-Life Balance', 'Pays on time, some people are truly wonderful though they are rarely in positions of influence.', 'Intellectually stimulating environment for people who enjoy doing research']
cons: ['none so far, but will revisit', 'Not always willing to look internally for candidates and very flat org chart so hard to move up.', 'Lack of suffecient benefits for researchers mid level and below', 'Company structure/hierarchy is a bit vague so escalation pathways are not clear.', 'Lack of ability to make a decision and stick to it Turnover of senior leaders in research and development', 'Too new to be able to tell', 'Career advancement sometimes depends on existing working relationships.', 'Advancement Daily Metrics Communication with Leaders', 'Lack of direction, poor management, constantly confusing managers with leaders. DEI is a joke, no development or career advancement if not in the bourbon club or talking rather than improving the lives of people living with severe diseases.', 'Bad work life balance, long hours']

job_description:
Job Purpose
The purpose of this job is to support the Country Manager, sales team and local management with commercial and data-driven insights and tools that identify customer and market-based trends, drive sales force excellence and ultimately support sales performance and profitability growth.
Responsibilities
Design and maintenance of local dashboards across all business units
Stakeholder in development of centralized Business Information systems and reporting tools
Investigating operational requirements, problems, and opportunities. Seeking effective busi-ness solutions to improve the way data is used to help drive the business and maximise growth
Support function for local heads of sales and management to provide deep-dive ad hoc analy-sis (pricing, profitability, pipeline, activity analysis)
Using data to direct and support the efforts of the Sales Team to drive sales including proposing, evaluating and tracking discreet campaigns to drive new customer acquisition and repeat ordering.
Tracking performance of initiatives, monitoring risks and opportunities
Supporting the sales and marketing team to identify prospects using data analysis/data mining techniques, feeding those leads to the sales team via sales leadership.
Support commercial decision making awareness and sales campaign performance
Work on bespoke reporting for either projects or opportunities with the Lead Team and Country manager
Management Information reporting and rebate calculation for external clients
Responsible for quarterly/annual commission calculations and key role in business planning and target setting process alongside sales management
Maintenance of UK CPQ (quoting tool) system data and training collateral
Assist in ongoing CPQ (quoting tool) system development alongside HQ and local product managers
Responsible for calculation, communication, and monitoring of discount scheme
Supporting the calculation of commission/bonus payments
Link between sales and operations for data integrity
Support the rollout of new systems and new versions of existing systems including data migration and system integration
Adhoc projects
The Candidate
In view of the involvement in the organization and the role itself, the successful candidate should have the following qualifications, background and personal style
Education/ Professional Experience
Graduate (or similar) in an analytical/numerical discipline e.g. Mathematics, Physics, Econo-metrics
Advance Excel including macros
BI system experience (e.g. PowerBI, SAP Analytics Cloud, Snowflake)
Experience of CRM systems an advantage
Experience of large databases
Experience of SAP, useful but not essential
Good attention to detail
Good spoken communication manner and style
Fluent in Dutch and English
Personal Competencies
Energetic, straight-forward and performance-driven professional with strong execution abilities
Strong interest in analytics and the value they can have in helping a business to thrive
Commercial mindset with a keen interest in helping to drive the business
Stakeholder management - Work collaboratively with people at all levels and across all disci-plines within the Straumann Group
pros: ['best tech awesome culture awesome company', 'Good company takes care of their employees. Offers insurance that company pays 90% of the premium.', 'Great benefits and 401k plan', 'Good Medical and Dental benefits. + 401 K\nImplant reimbursement if you need them\nBest implant technology', '- Great pay and benefits']
cons:
['high pace
high stress
customers timeline are tight', 'Slight favoritism for Straumann reps over other divisions of the group.', 'Was bullied by a female manager who had issues with other women, particularly women with small children. Other women on my team also felt they were treated differently from their male counterparts. When I spoke up to HR they started a fast track to fire me, even though my numbers were significantly up from my start date. The company is very lucky I did not go after them for discrimination. Company also deters you from addressing customer service issues which is the foundation of creating strong relationships with your customers. You are encouraged to pass them off to customer service but they do not get handled, leaving your customers extremely frustrated. Overall from talking to other employees the company had a low morale, and was very cut throat. High turnover rates of employment. Constantly changing policies and commission structures in a not so beneficial way for the salesperson. Leaving this toxic work environment was the best thing ever.', 'Con #1 The digital side of the Straumann Group is now managed by implant managers. The DSS used to cover all brands now just a single brand. This causes DSS's to compete against each other and be more dependent on fewer implant reps. Clearcorrect reps now handle their own digital leads so they are also competing with the DSS's. 

DSS compensation is now significantly lower than implant rep compensation. Significantly. 

Con #2 Can not sell the complete digital workflow. This is a big deal. No photogrammetry, no chairside mill, and no CBCT. Simply offer scanners, 3D printers that still lack full arch temp resins (been "validating" them for a year), surgical design software, and a mill that is purchased for full arch.', '- Waited a month to train me
- Once trained, little to no support was provided- I would ask questions and get no response or help
- Not great community feel
- Expectations set in the interview did not align with the job
- Must work with difficult sales associates']

job_description:
Job Description
Everyone at Kite is grounded by one common goal – curing cancer. Every single day, we seek to establish a direct line between that purpose and our day-to-day work. Would you like to join us in this mission?
We are seeking a highly motivated individual to join our team in Hoofddorp, Netherlands as an IT Business Systems Analyst.
As an IT Business Systems Analyst you will be responsible for the delivery of support on the technology platforms, that support Kite’s operations in our manufacturing site. The IT Business Systems Analyst will collaborate with their business counterparts in identifying new enhancements to enterprise and quality systems. This includes request prioritization, gathering of detailed IT requirements, updating and approving specifications, test scripts, and supporting user acceptance testing.
You will be an integral and highly visible part of Kite’s Site IT team, reporting directly to the Site IT head. The Site IT team acts as the ‘face of IT’ to Kite’s manufacturing organization. Your efforts will support the delivery and performance of the IT systems, ensuring quality and high availability.
Responsibilities of the IT Business Systems Analyst include (but are not limited to):
Work with BPO to engage vendor during new product discovery to understand IT requirements and the product’s impact on the current environment
Liaison to QC/Manufacturing functional departments to support development of business cases for new business capabilities
Continue to develop an understanding of the business processes and all applicable procedures
In-depth knowledge of GxP operations as it relates to the FDA’s CFR 21 Part 11 requirements and well as Good Documentation Practices (GDP)
Install and configure Lab/Manufacturing computer systems in a regulated GMP environment
Oversee and support managed services staff with the installation/configuration of regulated Lab/Manufacturing GMP systems
Work with vendor’s tech support teams to resolve application errors as need
Serve as the System Owner/Manager and perform administrative tasks on QC/Manufacturing instruments/systems such as user additions, removal, method/assay updates
Partner with local QA/QE to evaluate and test new upgrades/patches to Operating Systems/applications and write install instruction for Lab/MFG managed services support personnel
Participate in process re-engineering workshops with business and IT stakeholders
Perform impact assessment on changing product capabilities, including impact to integrated (boundary) systems
Respond to IT support requests to address operational issues with enterprise and quality applications
Meet with internal clients and stakeholders to diagnose software and middleware issues
Align with other manufacturing sites and corporate IT to ensure global consistency
Review/develop SOPs related to administration and installation of applications used in the lab/manufacturing environments
Work with QC and Manufacturing to fulfil audit requests for all instruments/systems
Review audit trails with QC and Manufacturing to ensure data integrity and compliance
Identify/participate in data integrity solutions to ensure FDA compliance for all GxP devices and systems
Basic Qualifications:
MA/MS degree with 3+ years of Operations and/or Manufacturing, IT and/or OAT (Operational automation Technology) experience OR
BA/BS degree with 5+ years of Operations and/or Manufacturing IT and/or OAT (Operational automation Technology) experience OR
High School Degree with 9+ years of Operations and/or Manufacturing IT and/or OAT (Operational automation Technology) experience
GMP experience
Preferred Qualifications:
BS degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or relevant field
Proven work experience (5+ years) in IT supporting business operations
Experience in a strongly regulated GxP environment, preferably pharmaceutical
Good understanding and knowledge of computer systems, mobile devices, networks and other technology products
Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot basic technical issues
Familiarity with remote desktop applications and help desk software
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
Ability to troubleshoot complex software issues and provide step-by-step technical help, both written and verbal
Good time management skills, interpersonal skills, and the ability to think critically
Resilient with the ability to perform in an ambiguous environment and under pressure
Versatile with the ability to deliver against strongly regulated requirements
Consistent excellence in both planning and execution
Located in the Netherlands
pros: ['Great Candidate Experience! Having worked in HR for 20+ years, it is always fascinating to be on the candidate side of the table during the interview process. I was very impressed with from start to finish. I had a three (3) Zoom calls with Kite Leadership, along with calls with the recruiter. All were very professional, easy to speak to, and engaging. I never thought I was grilled about my background, but rather shared stories about my past as if catching up with someone from my past. Equally, they all shared their experiences and how they ended up with a great company. Additionally, all explained their passion for working for a company that is helping to fight and cure cancer! All had amazing enthusiasm for the mission! The candidate process was thoroughly explained to me and communication was prompt and timely. I also think they all did an excellent job of explaining what to expect in the role in terms of responsibility, success in the role, work life balance, etc. Lastly, I never felt like I was in the dark about what to expect next in the candidate process. I was sent company information, along with benefit information, and had contact information if I had any questions. I never went onsite to the facility during the process, as they have kept the interviewing process to Zoom from the pandemic. I was sent an inspiring promotional video that interviewed some employees and flashed through the facility. During the offer, I was offered to visit onsite, but declined as I didn’t want to step outside of their normal protocols and stated that from the promotional video I was sent, “it looks like it may be the nicest facility I’ve ever worked!” Overall, again a great experience and looking forward to orientation and starting!', "Very young and nice atmosphere. It's not a suit and tie environment but more so casual.", 'I feel appreciated and am paid well. I feel great going to work and knowing my staff are paid well and have room to grow if they want to. The company is working hard to promote inclusion, diversity, and equity. I have had many jobs in my life but none have been nearly as rewarding. I feel like a human and not a number. As a leader I’m encouraged to ask, “how can we help ________ succeed?” instead of, “How do we get rid of _______?” We consistently have employee appreciation and engagement events. I don’t need to worry that if I need office supplies for my job that I’ll have to buy them myself due to budgeting or whatever. I can’t say enough good things about this company. They have changed my life in the most profound way.', 'Extremely great benefits with a competitive pay. They hire great people to work with (associate level). Volunteering opportunities are great if you’re interested, and the facilities are fabulous and kept extremely well.', '1) Quality department has good managers. 2) Engaging consequential work that has me looking forward to work days 3) Excellent benefits, including healthcare. 4) Very diverse workforce of people who care. 5) Company is growing. 6) Reasonable conversational interviewing process. Lighter in the way of tests. I applaud the company for not doing one-way interviews!', 'They strive to develop your skills and your career. Stipends are given to go to workshops and trainings that further develop your skillet.', 'Great culture, great work life balance, beautiful brand new facility']
cons: ['None for the candidate process.', 'The hours could really be stressful for certain departments.', 'Many people start as contact workers. This can be seen as both positive and negative. It gives less job stability to begin with, but if you show you are a good employee and you care, it is just a matter of time before you get the full time position through Kite.', 'Managements a mess, corporate and HR do not care the slightest for CTS department, otherwise considered MFG. Problems are not addressed, good work culture is lacking, and room for growth is nonexistent due to trapping employees with science degrees in a manufacturing department not doing anything science related. The billion dollar company does not compensate the MFG/CTS department for working 365 days a year. Administration gets a full week off in July and a full week off in December for Christmas and NYE and day, while the MFG department works on holiday with NO holiday pay or compensation - nor are the days that are scheduled off for administration comped for MFG employees. MFG works 10 hour shifts but is only given 80 hours for sick time a year, after that they have to use their own PTO time for sick days/any form of time off because it is not offered otherwise. That means 8 days out of 365 are you allowed to be sick. PTO is only accrued biweekly - and low and slow for entry level positions. Leadership does not lead, only bosses employees. Associate CTSs are micromanaged and bossed around/treated like children.', '1) Long onboarding. 2) Rigid IT requirements that prevent flexible software work. 3) Lower pay band than big tech, though this less an issue with the company itself and more a larger biotech/pharma space issue. 4) Some office locations mean housing cost difficulties.', 'As of now there are no cons.', 'HR support is simultaneously nonexistent and hinders performance management']

job_description:
Site Name: Netherlands - Amsterdam
Posted Date: Mar 8 2022
Statistical Analyst
As Statistical Analyst, your role is to provide programmer/analyst expertise in delivering the programs and outputs.
Your responsibilities:
Writing specifications for SAS programs/macros for study specific analyses or at the standard level
Developing, maintaining and validating SAS programs/macros for study specific analyses or at the standard level
Plans and participates in programming/QC activities at a study- or standard level to deliver all data analysis outputs
Develops the tables, figures and listings (TFL)
Reviews and ensures adherence to standards at the study or standard level (e.g., especially in the area of Analysis Data Model (ADaM) and Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM) datasets, derivation, output definition and implementation).
Author or co-author of programming and database specifications and documentation
May represent the programming function on the study team.
Why you?
Basic Qualifications:
We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:
Bachelor’s degree in Bachelor in Statistics, Mathematics, Informatics or equivalent in professional experience
Ability to understand statistical concept and to have knowledge in SAS
3-6 years of experience in SAS programming (including SQL and SAS macro language)
Ability to design, test and maintain programs.
Ability to create programs for multiple use
Understanding of clinical trial process.
Basic knowledge of applied statistics is an asset.
written and verbal communication skills in English.
Preferred Qualifications:
If you have the following characteristics it would be a plus:
Solid grounding in clinical, medical and pharmaceutical science with the ability to rapidly assimilate specific and detailed knowledge in these areas
Experience evaluating and effectively communicating evidence-based medicine
Ability to work in matrix and cross-functional teams
Strong scientific communication and presentation skills
pro-active ‘can-do’ mindsetLi-GSK
Why GSK?
Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture. These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork in a culture of Innovation, Performance and Trust.
GSK Vaccines – Our Vaccines business has a broad portfolio and innovative pipeline of vaccines to protect people of all ages. We deliver over two million vaccine doses per day to people living in over 160 countries.
For further information, please visit www.gsk.com.
At GSK we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. We aim to create an inclusive workplace where all employees feel engaged, supportive of one another, and know their work makes an important contribution.
We provide a supportive working environment, and a range of development challenges and opportunities. We also offer competitive benefits and compensation packages designed to attract and to retain the very best.
If you require an accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at GSK, please contact the GSK Service Centre at 1-877-694-7547 (US Toll Free) or +1 801 567 5155 (outside US).
GSK is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.
Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies
GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.
Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. For more information, please visit GSK’s Transparency Reporting For the Record site.
pros: ["The vision, the mission, the people - for me, it's a perfect place to be. GSK has nearly 100,000 employees, but everyone I worked with was an actual person, a human being who cares about the patient at the end of the supply chain. It's a busy company to work for, with lots of activity which makes it fun and interesting.", 'Learning new things daily, Getting to know your team, good money', 'Everyone I worked with at GSK tended to be among the best at what they do compared to other companies I worked at. It’s a demanding but fair culture', 'Position allows employees to develop in several areas with innovative technology, knowledgeable analysts, and support from management. GSK pays for schooling throughout the program and offers an employee re-embursement program for further education. GSK funds development trip to the UK to work with international apprentices. There is always room for growth and development within a rotation.', 'My manager and my team', 'Product leadership, competitive income, global organization']
cons: ["Nothing, genuinely. Seems like a paid review but it's not.", 'Long shifts, strenuous work, Bad supervisors', 'It’s a global company, which for me meant an unbelievable amount of travel. I saw the world while working at GSK, but it can take a toll on your personal life', "Pay is low for the amount of work expected. When switching rotations there can be a lag to training. There isn't enough time to learn and develop into everything throughout a rotation.", 'Our leadership team not making decisions or making bad ones', 'Develop opportunities, R&D of new produts']

job_description:
Site Name: Netherlands - Amsterdam
Posted Date: Feb 13 2023
Your responsibilities :
Responsible for a whole study from design to execution for different study designs:
to use stat methodology to establish study strategy (e.g. power modelling of different scenarios, set up power monitoring, set up mitigation plan to minimize risk of stat failure)
to provide input to protocol (design, objective, endpoint, randomization strategy, sample size, stat analysis) - to provide input to study set up (CRF review, randomization, DMP plan including specification for subset, important protocol deviation)
to develop SAP/AAR (involving sensitivity analysis to support robustness of result) and coordinate review - to review the TFL, to coordinate review with the stat analyst, to approve the TFL
to do the QC of the statistical analysis methodology - to validate study specific dataset & analysis pgm specification - to approve deviation from TFL format - to propose SAR conclusion
to prepare answer to study specific stat question (e.g. inspection, RA question) - to provide stat support to an independent analysis center
to provide consultancy on stat matter for other statisticians
Why you?
Basic Qualifications:
We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:
At least 5-year experience of pharmaceutical industry Has been previously responsible for studies with different designs (dose range, superiority/non inferiority, futility rule,..)
Experience in SAS software and sample size computation for standard designs Ability to work in multidisciplinary team (e.g. give guidance to non-stat, provide feedback, engage) , some being remotely located
Good oral and written communication in English including ability to explain difficult issues and situations clearly and ensures meaning is understood
Preferred Qualifications:
If you have the following characteristics it would be a plus:
University degree in Sciences, Statistics, Mathematics or equivalent Master in Statistics, Mathematics, Epidemiology or equivalent
To be able to lead the development of new biometrics/epidemiological methods to gain efficiency and meet product development needs.LI-GSK
Why GSK?
Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture. These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork in a culture of Innovation, Performance and Trust.
GSK Pharmaceuticals – Our Pharmaceuticals business offers a unique portfolio of medicines & vaccines, including a broad range of innovative and established brands. Both globally and in Belgium, we are currently primarily focused on developing new medicines in the respiratory, HIV/infectious diseases, oncology and immuno-inflammation areas, while also continuously exploring other fields through discovery research. Working in BeNeLux, you would be joining a driven team of over 200 people that is also well embedded within GSK’s global network. For further information, please visit www.gsk.com.
At GSK we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. We aim to create an inclusive workplace where all employees feel engaged, supportive of one another, and know their work makes an important contribution.
We provide a supportive working environment, and a range of development challenges and opportunities. We also offer competitive benefits and compensation packages designed to attract and to retain the very best.
If you require an accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at GSK/ViiV Healthcare, please contact the local HR department.
GSK is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.
GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose – to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together – so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns – as an organisation where people can thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it, and we aim to impact the health of 2.5 billion people around the world in the next 10 years.
Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it’s also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a workplace where everyone can feel a sense of belonging and thrive as set out in our Equal and Inclusive Treatment of Employees policy. We’re committed to being more proactive at all levels so that our workforce reflects the communities we work and hire in, and our GSK leadership reflects our GSK workforce.
GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose – to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together – so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns – as an organisation where people can thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it, and we aim to impact the health of 2.5 billion people around the world in the next 10 years.
Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it’s also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a workplace where everyone can feel a sense of belonging and thrive as set out in our Equal and Inclusive Treatment of Employees policy. We’re committed to being more proactive at all levels so that our workforce reflects the communities we work and hire in, and our GSK leadership reflects our GSK workforce.
If you require an accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at GSK, please contact the GSK Service Centre at 1-877-694-7547 (US Toll Free) or +1 801 567 5155 (outside US).
GSK is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.
Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies
GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.
Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. For more information, please visit GSK’s Transparency Reporting For the Record site.
pros: ["The vision, the mission, the people - for me, it's a perfect place to be. GSK has nearly 100,000 employees, but everyone I worked with was an actual person, a human being who cares about the patient at the end of the supply chain. It's a busy company to work for, with lots of activity which makes it fun and interesting.", 'Learning new things daily, Getting to know your team, good money', 'Everyone I worked with at GSK tended to be among the best at what they do compared to other companies I worked at. It’s a demanding but fair culture', 'Position allows employees to develop in several areas with innovative technology, knowledgeable analysts, and support from management. GSK pays for schooling throughout the program and offers an employee re-embursement program for further education. GSK funds development trip to the UK to work with international apprentices. There is always room for growth and development within a rotation.', 'My manager and my team', 'Product leadership, competitive income, global organization']

I saw the world while working at GSK, but it can take a toll on your personal life', "Pay is low for the amount of work expected. When switching rotations there can be a lag to training. There isn't enough time to learn and develop into everything throughout a rotation.", 'Our leadership team not making decisions or making bad ones', 'Develop opportunities, R&D of new produts']

job_description:
Janssen Biologics B.V. is one of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, and is passionate about the development, production and marketing of vaccines and antibodies to prevent and combat infectious diseases. At the Leiden site in the Netherlands, hard-working and multi-skilled people are working in a high-performance culture in which innovation and a 'can do' state of mind are the central points.
The Chemical, Physical & Raw Materials (CPRm) department is part of the Quality Control (QC) department of Janssen Biologics B.V, located in Leiden (The Netherlands). The CPRm department consists of 40 highly skilled employees, of a total of 280 employees within QC.

As a part of the QC laboratories, the CPRm team is responsible for the execution of test methods using various analytical techniques. The scope of products varies from biologicals and vaccines, derived from early clinical batches up to commercial batches. The testing of the more than 170 raw materials is outsourced to a network of external test laboratories.
You will be working in a team of ten colleagues, that is exclusively concerned with the QC aspects of clinical and commercial raw materials.
These are the 4 main work areas for this highly motivated team:
Coordination of all raw material sample handling and testing for already qualified materials as well as new materials.
Handling of quality events related to testing of raw materials at the contract laboratory
Review of test results and release of raw materials for commercial use for our production sites in Leiden and Cork (Ireland)
Introduction of new Raw materials and the qualifications of new sources of existing materials to meet the business needs.
These are the responsibilities the job will bring you:
Introduction of new Raw materials and the qualifications of new sources
Coordinate NPI activities in relation to raw material qualifications and ensure on time completion per agreed timelines.
Create, review, and approve related documentation.
Act as subject matter expert for analytical method transfers and other NPI processes and has a leading role during the GMP inspections.
Participates in meetings with various local/global/internal/external stakeholders in the frame of his/her NPI project.
Ensure NPI testing plan is aligned with the platform testing strategy
Adhere to compliance best practices, EHSS regulations and lean principles.
Management of deviations in respect to raw materials testing:
Acting as lead investigator for local/global Non-Conformances which encompasses conducting the investigation, providing impact assessments, and identifying and defining appropriate corrective and preventive actions.
Supporting and advising other investigators from external and internal QC departments.
Monitor timely closure of medium/high-level investigations and associated Corrective & Preventive Actions.
Providing scientific and technical analytical support to the testing laboratories:
Serve as an expert on physical and chemical technologies used for raw materials testing and will be requested to represent the team during internal/external meetings. The jobholder will act as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) during audits and inspections and will write observation responses.
Lead or participate in exciting projects or studies to maintain quality of the testing of the raw materials
Lead and drive continuous improvement processes to contribute to a lean culture in the area of testing and to improve our cost competitiveness.
Qualifications
This is what you will bring to the job:
A bachelor’s degree in Analytical Chemistry, Pharmacy or equivalent
3-5 years of experience in a Quality Control environment with demonstrable knowledge of pharmaceutical raw materials and associated regulations
Knowledge of GMP/GLP guidelines
Proven capabilities in managing smaller and/or larger projects
Result-oriented, team player, self-starter
Excellent communication skills (oral and written in English)
This is what awaits you at J&J:
Flexible working hours
An opportunity to be part of a global market leader
Possibilities for further personal and professional development/education
Excellent record in employee continuous personal and professional development
Excellent Benefits
pros: ['Was a good company when I first started and the experience is differentiated based on who your direct manager and team are. Benefits were decent, most people are nice, and lots of smart people to work with.', 'Purpose of the company (Credo) is very meaningful and motivating factor to work @ J&J Work life balance is good Culture is very good as well', "What a great company. Excellent health care benefits as you would expect from a pharmaceutical company and management really is there to help the employees. The training programs that they have are the best that I've ever seen and the employees that are here are really smart and happy to be working for the company. It's just such a good environment to work in.", 'Tactical level employees and leadership are fine', 'Great team collaboration; flexible remote work schedule, good support to grow professionally, great benefits. Management is very accessible.']
cons: ['New CEO and senior leadership are out of touch - demanding longer work hours, unwilling to adjust pay to fair market conditions, and reducing bonus while they sit in their ivory tower with millions of dollars in bonus after quietly laying off large portions of the workforce. The last soul of what J&J used to be died when our CMO left and with him, many executives have left as well. Paraphrasing from a townhall, executive leadership accuses employees are working longer hours because they are working from home and are not as productive. Advancement is based off of who you know and the color of your skin even though J&J tries to create optics that they care about DEI. Employees are criminally underpaid and they pride themselves in squishing levels. This is an empty shell of a company and no longer is a good place to work.', "Given its a big company, its bit slow in terms of execution on key initiatives. Also being in healthcare industry, the release cycles are slow (4 to 5 years) as everything has to account for proper validation, testing, auditing, compliance, security and more importantly prepare for FDA approval. Don't expect to be a fast paced work environment.", "Can't think of any cons. It's just really a good company to work for. They get the best talent in the industry and just let them go and do their thing. I haven't seen anybody that does any kind of micromanaging or anything like that, so it's just really nice to be at a company that allows you to be yourself!", 'New CEO is out of touch. No salary inflation adjustments and actually had the gall to reduce everyone’s bonus payouts. Combine that with the tone deaf efforts to push people back into the office while continuing have overpriced and lackluster cafeteria food and bare bones amenities for employees. J&J is no longer a great place to work. Leadership likes to pontificate about culture when it is nothing more than lip service', 'I have no complaints to offer.']

job_description:
Insulet started in 2000 with an idea and a mission to enable our customers to enjoy simplicity, freedom and healthier lives through the use of our Omnipod® product platform. In the last two decades we have improved the lives of hundreds of thousands of patients by using innovative technology that is wearable, waterproof, and lifestyle accommodating.
We are looking for highly motivated, performance driven individuals to be a part of our expanding team. We do this by hiring amazing people guided by shared values who exceed customer expectations. Our continued success depends on it!
Job Title: Senior Privacy Analyst
Department: IT GRC
FLSA Status: N/A
Position Overview:
With the increased footprint of Insulet internationally, a new role is created under the IT GRC function to support Insulet’s IT Privacy Team in the area of Data Privacy and Security. The person will be specialist in GDPR with good understanding of Data Privacy and Security issues. Working in a dynamic, collaborative environment, the successful candidate will support Insulet’s Privacy Compliance with new products, new markets and new functions through Privacy analysis across the entire organization. This role will focus on translating privacy requirements into technical and functional solutions for key projects and processes related to our EU and International Operations. This is a hands-on role with a technical focus, playing a key position in the global growth of Insulet over the next years. The role reports to Privacy Manager and will work closely with other departments (R&D/engineering, IT, Legal, Medical and Customer Care).
Responsibilities:
Work with the Privacy Manager and other members of the Privacy team to provide expert advice and guidance to employees across the business/regions in relation to Data Privacy requirements and protection of Personal Data
Engage with product development teams to ensure that the Insulet’s products and services continue to meet Data Privacy requirements and the development programs include privacy by design principles
Perform Data Protection Impact Assessments / Privacy Impact Assessments
Develop and maintain comprehensive Data Privacy policies and procedures including Insulet wide privacy policies, data retention policies, Privacy register policies and Privacy by design policy
Develop and maintain a comprehensive knowledge of Data Privacy and Personal Data protection legislation and regulation, implementing any changes and informing relevant parts of the Insulet’s Personal Data processing operations
Advise Insulet’s businesses on Data Privacy risks, issues, and how to mitigate or navigate them
Manage the Data Privacy and Risk Registers, ensuring accurate records of significant Personal Data processing across the business and identifying and managing associated risks.
Produce and develop appropriate metrics and updates to demonstrate effective privacy program operations and governance
Work with the Information Security team to investigate potential breaches and participate in incident response processes
Work with the Insulet’s legal team to implement appropriate contractual measures for Personal Data protection issues including model clauses where appropriate
Maintain awareness with evolving regulatory guidance and compliance frameworks that impact the Insulet’s international operations
Performs other duties as required
Education and Experience:
Minimum Requirements:
Bachelors or Masters degree in Privacy, Security, software engineering or a closely related field is required
At least 5 years of experience in the field of Data Privacy or Information Security
Strong knowledge of the core Data Privacy concepts– consent, fair processing, legal bases for processing, anonymization/pseudonymization, privacy by design
Familiarity with Data Privacy-relevant legislation and regulations, including the European Union General Data Protection Regulation (EU GDPR), E-Privacy, the UK Data Protection Act 1998
Recognized Data Privacy qualifications (CIPP/E - CIPT)
Knowledge on ISO 27K and/ or NIST is highly desirable
CIPP/A, CISA and/or CRISC certifications considered a strong plus
Fluent in English. Fluency in German or French are an added advantage
Preferred Skills and Competencies:
Ability to translate Data Privacy requirements into Functional system/product Requirements and user requirements in the software and product life cycle development process
Ability to meet and overcome the challenges of fast paced environment while building a positive work relationship between Business, Legal and IT.
Ability to rapidly identify, evaluate, and resolve conflicts and complaints.
Excellent communication skills – both written and verbal with the ability to influence at all levels of the organization.
Strong organizational skills and ability to plan and prioritize work while responding flexibly to changing priorities
Self-motivated and uses initiative to proactively resolve problems. Deals with conflicting priorities calmly, reliably, and effectively.
Physical Requirements (if applicable):
This position is eligible for hybrid working arrangements (requires on-site work from the Dutch office in Utrecht at least 1x/week; may work remotely other days). Insulet’s Utrecht office is located 1 minute from central station in Utrecht.
Role may require up to 5% travel.
NOTE: This position is eligible for hybrid working arrangements (requires on-site work from an Insulet office at least 1x/week; may work remotely other days). #LI-hybrid

At the intersection between Med Devices and consumer electronics.', 'Mission Driven Passionate Culture Great Teamwork Great Leadership', 'Very nice people to work with']

I have difficulty seeing a future at this company as opportunity for career growth is limited in my division.', 'Competitive Internal Culture but hard working', 'Goals are aggressive but new product amazing', "Remote work environment quickly turned into a hostile work environment where you will be isolated and berated for asking questions. Harsh work environment, little communication between teams lead to disfunction, disorganization and constant problems. Upper management is awful, no empathy, you are a NUMBER and treated as such with a sink or swim culture. You will be given minimal, incomplete training. Hours were heavy, no work life balance as upper management doesn't care and expects the job to be done even if there are issues, no matter how long it takes. Just don't, listen to the other reviews about upper management, they are truthful. High IQ and 0 EQ. Lack of transparency and integrity. Little to none people management skills. Borderline abusive. Thought it would be solved but these values are promoted and nurtured at top level. Would not recommend Timelines are higher priority than quality.', 'Hard to move up and unclear career trajectory', 'Very ambitious and somewhat unrealistic goals']

job_description:
At ICON, it’s our people that set us apart. Our diverse teams enable us to become a better partner to our customers and help us to fulfil our mission to advance and improve patients’ lives.
Our ‘Own It’ culture is driven by four key values that bring us together as individuals and set us apart as an organisation: Accountability & Delivery, Collaboration, Partnership and Integrity. We want to be the Clinical Research Organisation that delivers excellence to our clients and to patients at every touch-point. In short, to be the partner of choice in drug development.
That’s our vision. We’re driven by it. And we need talented people who share it.
If you’re as driven as we are, join us. You’ll be working in a dynamic and supportive environment, with some of the brightest and the friendliest people in the sector, and you’ll be helping shape an industry.
Bij ICON ben je niet enkel getuige van de toekomst van klinische geneesmiddelenontwikkeling. Je maakt er deel van uit!
Wij groeien, snel!
Voor de afdeling Flow Cytometrie van ons laboratorium in Assen zijn wij op zoek naar een enthousiaste nieuwe collega.
Heb jij een afgeronde opleiding op MBO-4 of HBO niveau in een biomedische of chemische richting? Zoek je een uitdagende baan binnen een lab met de nieuwste apparatuur en technieken? Dan is ICON op zoek naar jou!
Het bioanalytisch laboratorium van ICON is gevestigd in Assen. Hier worden met behulp van verschillende technieken (o.a. LC-MS/MS, radioactieve isotopen analyse, ELISA, flowcytometrie en HPLC) analyses uitgevoerd van (nieuwe) geneesmiddelen en biomarkers in monsters van biologische matrices afkomstig van (pre-)klinische studies vanuit de hele wereld. We werken met de nieuwste apparatuur en innovaties. Er wordt nauw samengewerkt met onze collega’s in Kansas City, waar zich het andere bioanalytische laboratorium van ICON bevindt.
Voor het laboratorium in Assen zijn we op zoek naar een nieuwe collega's!
Lab analist (32-40 uur per week in Assen)
Wat ga je doen?
Je bent als Lab Analist samen met je team verantwoordelijk voor het analyseren van samples en het verwerken van resultaten
Je voert zelfstandig de selectie, voorbewerking, analyses en dataverwerking uit
Je wordt getraind binnen de afdeling Flow cytometrie
We bieden jou:
Een uitdagende functie in een groeiend internationaal bedrijf in ons state-of-the-art onderzoekslaboratorium in Assen
Een marktconform salaris
PRA heeft een eigen CAO die zorgt voor goede voorwaarden voor onze medewerkers
Jaarlijks organiseren we (sportieve) activiteiten gericht op o.a. teambuilding en gezelligheid. We zetten ons ook maatschappelijk in en beklimmen bijvoorbeeld bergtoppen voor een goed doel
Je start met een jaarcontract met zicht op een verlenging of vast dienstverband
Binnen ons bedrijf zijn er meerdere carrièremogelijkheden, o.a. richting leiding geven, projectmanagement of methodeontwikkeling
Wat breng je mee?
Je hebt een voltooide MBO-4 of HBO opleiding in een biomedische of chemische richting (bv. Biologie en Medisch Laboratoriumonderzoek, Chemie, Forensic Science, Biomedische wetenschappen etc.)
Ervaring met GLP is gewenst, maar zeker geen vereiste
Je bent nauwkeurig en flexibel
Goede beheersing van de Engelse taal, in woord en geschrift
We bieden contracten vanaf 32 uur per week tot fulltime dienstverband
Wat doet ICON?
In opdracht van farmaceutische bedrijven doet ICON wereldwijd wetenschappelijk onderzoek naar de werking van geneesmiddelen bij mensen. In Noord-Nederland heeft ICON de divisie Early Development Services (EDS), waar zowel klinisch als bioanalytisch onderzoek wordt verricht. Hier zijn zo’n 1000 medewerkers werkzaam. Werken bij ICON betekent dat je werkt aan de ontwikkeling van de geneesmiddelen van de toekomst. Het betekent ook werken aan jezelf en bijdragen aan de ontwikkeling en groei van ICON. De ontwikkeling van onze mensen is het succes van onze organisatie. Onze internationale cultuur en dynamische organisatie trekt vooral mensen aan die gericht zijn op professionele groei, een belangrijke pijler voor onze organisatie die we graag koesteren. We bieden je de mogelijkheden die je in staat stellen om je carrière naar een hoger niveau te tillen.
Contact informatie:
Voor meer informatie kun je contact opnemen met Sophia Allinson, Recruitment Specialist via email - Sophia.Allinson@iconplc.com.
Klaar voor een nieuwe uitdaging en wil je werken in ons state-of-the-art onderzoekslaboratorium?
Ben je na al deze informatie nog enthousiaster geworden? Dat snappen we, we komen graag met je in contact! Klik op de ‘Solliciteer’ button op deze pagina en laat je CV en motivatie achter.
 Voor deze rol is het van belang dat men vloeiend is in de Nederlandse taal. Engelse taalvaardigheid is een pre
Benefits of Working in ICON:
Our success depends on the quality of our people. That’s why we’ve made it a priority to build a culture that rewards high performance and nurtures talent.
We offer very competitive salary packages. And to keep them competitive, we regularly benchmark them against our competitors. Our annual bonuses reflect delivery of performance goals – both ours and yours.
We also provide a range of health-related benefits to employees and their families and offer competitive retirement plans – and related benefits such as life assurance – so you can save and plan with confidence for the years ahead.
But beyond the competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits, you’ll benefit from an environment where you are encouraged to fulfil your sense of purpose and drive lasting change.
ICON is an equal opportunity and inclusive employer and is committed to providing a workplace free of discrimination and harassment. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.
If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or in order to perform the essential functions of a position, please let us know through the form below.
pros: ['Supportive line managers, great coworkers and department collaboration', 'Line managers are great and help with career development. 100% remote and allow for children to be at home with you, being that you are hitting your metrics. Good word life balance, no expectation for you to work on weekends or past your working hours. No shame for taking PTO.', 'Everyone is so nice, and they do a great job at onboarding. Managers are flexible and quite nice. I feel comfortable here.', 'Icon formally Docs has taken more care in their employees and have listened to concerns. Training is readily available.', 'Great Benefits and Bonuses, Great Line Management Support, remote work, Great IT Support.', 'The pay is competitive, which is why most CRA’s move to ICON from other CRO’s and biotech companies (like i did). However, I have never met a happy CRA with ICON. Never. All of us are burnt out and depressed, and have double the workload of a normal CRA with another CRO. there is no work to life balance at all, and the management is very awful. only reason i’m with the company still is because my year ends in a couple of months and i will have to pay back a hefty sign on bonus if i leave before then. unless you are okay with working weekends and until midnight most week nights, i don’t recommend this job. the management doesn’t care about you - i had a panic attack because of the work load and my manager blamed it on me. no, i don’t have a history of anxiety. i will say they have great health insurance and probably other benefits that i’ve had little to no time to explore.', 'Remote work available. Good team.', 'Great people, office amenities, resources, etc.']
cons: ['Are told there are many opportunities to advance from this position but the company makes it impossible. No growth opportunities unless lateral movement to a different department first. Promotions taken away from the role, yearly merit increases of around 1%, expected to go above and beyond with nothing in return. Functional managers want to help staff but perks have been taken away and continue to be while additional tasks and responsibilities are tacked on to the role. The pay gap for cost of living has not been resolved.', 'Annual raises are small regardless of performance. Job levels aren’t clearly defined. No real maternity leave for US employees, only STD is offered and ICON lowered the amount from 70% to 60% pay when they took over.', 'The pay is just very low especially if you have to drive far or have loans. You can certainly work your way up in the company but it seems to take a little longer than it should, and the direct path upwards in the project associate role is a bit murky.', 'Sometimes you may be more informed than some of the managers that you are contracted under. And transparency is not something that should be given to global team.', 'Stressful, fast-paced, demanding, poor resourcing to studies, love the industry but some pharmaceutical sponsors are not easy to work with and make your job very difficult, few sponsors are easy to work with, it is really unfortunate, feel bullied by the sponsors. Most training is self-review which is not effective.', 'everything else other than the salary. i literally impulsively shop just to find a crumb of joy with working with this terrible company.', 'Salary could be more competitive.', 'Low pay compared to competitors, easy to burn out, some managers can make the job feel pretty impersonal.']

job_description:
Advanced Accelerator Applications, a Novartis company, is an innovative medicines company focused on the development of products for targeted radioligand therapy and precision radioligand imaging. We are committed to transforming patients’ lives by leading innovation in nuclear medicine.
AAA offers professionals the opportunity to face new challenges and pursue a career in a fast growing, technology driven healthcare company. We are passionate about improving patient health by leading innovation in nuclear medicine. We are looking for people who share our commitment to help us achieve this goal. Advanced Accelerator Applications is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE).

Job Description:

40+ is the dedicated number of team members you would be joining at IDB (Advanced Accelerator Applications, Netherlands) whose mission is to bring new therapies to patients wordwide by producing radiopharmaceuticals for targeted radioligand therapy. IDB 's team embraces the culture of empowerment and team work.

As a Radiation Safety Officer you will support day to day safe operations of isotope production by providing oversight on activities in the area of radiation (regular self-inspections of e.g. the process)

Responsibilities:
Review of radiation safety key performance indicators around dosimetry, events etc.Support the routine of STOP-THINK-ACT by providing direction how to handle unforeseen/ unplanned eventsMaintain the ‘Risico Inventarisatie en Evaluatie’ (Risk Inventory and Evaluation) by verification, continuously improving the current situation by striving to reduce risk and exposure for staffTraining of staff on site around radiation safetyAssessing changes in the current way of working (for instance new equipment) for impact on radiation safety, provide direction where neededAct as a coach and mentor for TMS staff in the field of radiation safety
Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:
Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.
Minimum requirements
What you'll bring to the role:
Certification as Radiation Safety Expert, Coordinerend Deskundige (former Niveau 3)Knowledge of a pharmaceutical or control production environmentA relevant MBO or HBO degree (Engineering, Biology and Medical Laboratory Research, or Chemical Analyst)
Attention to detail
Analytical skills that allow you to see what can be improved
Division
Oncology
Business Unit
ADVANCED ACCELERATOR APPLICATIONS
Country
Netherlands
Work Location
Baarle-Nassau
Company/Legal Entity
IDB Holland bv
Functional Area
Facilities & Administration

Full Time

The company is constantly growing, and leadership isn’t afraid to move forward.
